p: The clinical features of the confirmed Influenza A(H1N1)pdm09 infected cases had shown that fever and cough were the most common (89.6%) symptom followed by shortness of breath (72.7%) where as sore throat and nasal catarrh were less common symptoms. As per chest radiograph, 47.5% positive cases had signs of pneumonia. It was observed that 18.15% of patients among positives were staying in the community where one or more infected people were Influenza A(H1N1)pdm09 positive ( TableÂ 3).
